etymologies: late Middle English (denoting the astronomical instrument): from Latin quadrans, quadrant- ‘quarter’, from quattuor ‘four’

definitions: each of four quarters of a circle.
shortDefinitions: each of four quarters of circle

definitions: each of four parts of a plane, sphere, space, or body divided by two lines or planes at right angles

examples.text: the right upper quadrant of the kidney

shortDefinitions: each of four parts of plane, sphere, space

definitions: an instrument used for taking angular measurements of altitude in astronomy and navigation, typically consisting of a graduated quarter circle and a sighting mechanism.
shortDefinitions: instrument used for taking angular measurements of altitude

definitions: a frame fixed to the head of a ship's rudder, to which the steering mechanism is attached.
shortDefinitions: frame fixed to head of ship's rudder

definitions: a panel with slots through which a lever is moved to orient or otherwise control a mechanism.
shortDefinitions: panel with slots through which lever is moved to orient mechanism
